meanings.definition: A shortage or deficiency in supply.
meanings.sent1: The undersupply of food in the village led to hunger among the residents.
meanings.sent2: The undersupply of water in the desert caused great hardship for the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had an undersupply of snacks, so everyone had to ration their chips.
meanings.sent4: The undersupply of books in the library made it feel like a barren wasteland of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The undersupply of medicine in the clinic endangered the health of the patients.

meanings.definition: To provide an insufficient amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The store would undersupply the shelves with fresh produce, disappointing customers.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to undersupply the market with their new product to create a sense of exclusivity.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally undersupplied the recipe with salt, resulting in a bland dish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher would undersupply the students with hints, challenging them to think critically.
meanings.sent5: The gardener chose to undersupply the garden with water to promote stronger root growth.
